intro: Erigeron nuttallii, commonly known as Nuttall's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are usually hairy and alternate along the stem, while the flowers are pale yellow to white. Nuttall's fleabane is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
